19+ allocations technical guidance for 2022 to 2023.

Changes to your allocation

You must follow the apprenticeship funding rules. We can reduce or remove your allocation if there's evidence that public funds are at risk.

Allocation statements are not legally binding. They do not create any legal obligation against the Secretary of State for Education, acting through the Education and Skills Funding Agency (ESFA).

Submit a business case

You can submit a business case if you have given incorrect data to the ESFA and this has affected your funding allocation. For example, a mistake in your R04 return.

How 19+ funding is allocated

Find out more about how the ESFA allocates 19+ funding.
